ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to other students. The readings were very interesting. I liked that the professor had each student lead a weekly session. That assignment made me delve into subject and be able to explain it to others.
This course is an introduction to foundational theories and themes in Ethnic Studies. It is fantastic preparation for anyone who plans to research and/or teach in related fields.

Ethnic Studies is a great introduction to the field. I would definitely recommend this course to the graduate student who wants to see how raciality/ethnicity intersect and permeate various social formations.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Each week I looked forward to the readings. I found them to be very interesting and relevant. I feel like I have a better understanding of the field.

I believe this course will provide the critical thinking necessary in my foray through American Studies. Ethnic Studies has absolutely provided the fundaments of my thinking through race and ethnicity, the capacity for which I did not possess before. I feel much more equipped to deal with the topics that will come up in my dissertation and research.
